instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
green/orange..
U1950 
just pin 1(PP3V42_G3H)  get 3.4v all the rest 0v
was replaced U1950 but the same.. all around look good and no shorts..
also "shake" SMC but still the same.
any idea?

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
Do you mean pin 13?
Pin 1 is output; check diode mode to ground.

Do you get 3V3_S5?

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
sorry, pin 8 is 3.4v
there is 8 pins.
3v3_s5 - 0.5v

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
there is wired situation now...PPBUS 015 diode mode..1.1v
any idea how can i find the short?

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message: Check if any big coil has the same 015 to ground.

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
UPDATE:
PP3V3_S5 3.3V 
PP3V3S0_EN 0V 
no short, replace U8030 still the same..

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
What is exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (no battery)?
What was the problem of low resistance to ground?
Do you get 3V3_SUS?

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
I'm pretty sure you don't have 8V there.
I asked about EXACT voltage; don't you have 3 digits voltmeter?
It is probably good, if you get 3V3_SUS, but PLEASE post accurate information.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
PPBUS 8.597V
PM_PWRBTN_L 3.4V drop to 0v and back to 3.4v

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message: Check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L, at same time.

threads.title: 820-00165 no turning on..
threads.message:
"PM_SLP_S4_L 0.4v no short"
Not sure what this means?
Can you detect a pulse there, when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?
